intro: Harmogia cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's harmogia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, and its flowering period usually occurs during the warmer months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural reserves.
